author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: دِيارِهِمْ شَوْقًا لِلِقائِكَ وَمَنَعَهُمُ المُشْرِكُونَ عَنْ زِيارَةِ طَلْعَتِكَ وَالطَّوافِ حَوْلَ حَرَمِ كِبْرِيائِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ فَأَنْزِلْ عَلَيْهِمْ صَبْرًا مِنْ عِنْدِكَ، وَسُكُونًا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ.
translation: Thou seest, O my Lord, how Thy servants have left their homes in their longing to meet Thee, and how they have been hindered by the ungodly from looking upon Thy face, and from circumambulating the sanctuary of Thy grandeur. Pour out Thy steadfastness and send down Thy calm upon them, O my Lord! Thou art, in truth, the Ever-Forgiving, the Most Compassionate.
